Heading: Cities where rape/killing occurred
Value: Augusta, GA. Charleston, SC. North Atlanta, GA. South Atlanta, GA. Lexington, SC. Columbia, SC. Irmo, SC.

Heading: Number of siblings
Value: 2 sisters, Helen and Gail and 1 brother, Robert

Heading: Raised by
Value: Biological mother, Gerry and biological father, Richard

Heading: Problems in school?
Value: “Always” according to mother. Teacher told Danny’s mother that he was “hyperactive.” Problems at school were attributed to Danny’s classes bored him. He was thought to be too smart and never challenged. Teacher said he could do well if he would just settle down and apply him self.

Heading: Head injury?
Value:
Yes, had to be removed by forceps at birth. This caused severe bruising of the head immediately after delivery. At age 2/3 Danny fell out of a moving vehicle and tumbled out head first onto the street and was not taken to hospital for injury. A few years later Danny fell off the slide while hanging upside down falling head first onto asphalt 9ft. 
below. He was knocked unconscious and was taken to the hospital. The Doctor said he had suffered no serious damage.

Heading: Physically abused?
Value: Suspected possible abuse by childhood babysitter 12-year-old Andrea and her brother Fred. Andrea was found to not be changing Danny’s diaper causing severe diaper rash. Also suspected possible abuse from maid Agnes who also watched Danny as a child.

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value: Not by anyone other than himself. Danny was very hard on himself as a child.

Heading: Sexually abused?
Value: Suspected possible sexual abuse by childhood babysitters Andrea and Fred. Also possibly by maid Agnes.

Heading: Highest degree
Value: Attended two colleges, but no documentation of a degree

Heading: Grades in school
Value: Mostly C’s and B’s, occasional A

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Fired from jobs?
Value: Yes, from Betchel the day after story of killing hit media. Fired for exceeding number of days missed without excuse.

Heading: Types of jobs worked
Value: Fire protections system designer and technician at SRS, Betchel engineer

Heading: Employment status during series
Value: Employed, but never showed up, constantly called in sick

Heading: Time in forensic hospital?
Value: Attended multiple correctional facilities and admitted into psych ward of Columbia Jail, underwent psychological testing and treatment at Central State Hospital, Diagnosed at Hall Institute

Heading: Diagnosis
Value: Possible Atypical Paraphilia and possible Multiple Personality Disorder

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Date of first kill in series
Value: Between Christmas and New Year’s Eve of 1988

Heading: Date of final kill in series
Type of serial killer
Value: Only killed one victim, would be considered serial rapist

Heading: How close did killer live?
Value: About an hour away, drove to all victim’s houses

Heading: Location of first contact
Value: By phone, then at the girls’ houses

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Killing occurred in home of killer?
Value: Yes, at his home in Martinez

Heading: Victim abducted or killed at contact?
Tortured victims?
Value: Chained two victims at the ankle and placed them in his closet on separate occasions

Heading: Stalked victims?
Value: Didn’t stalk victims, but possible stalking at a young age

Heading: Used blindfold?
Value: Put tape over one victims (Jeannie) sunglasses so she was not able to see where she was being held

Heading: Sex with the body?
Value: Oral and vaginal smears during autopsy showed positive for semen (not clear if pre or post kill)

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Moved, no attempt to hide
Value: Danny wrapped Jean McCrea’s body in a green blanket and trash bags before dumping her into a creek bed near her home of Irmo, S.C.

Heading: Sentence
Value: After first two trials, sentenced to 5 consecutive life

Heading: Name and state of prison
Value: CCI, Hall Institute, currently at Lee Correctional Institution

Heading: Killer committed suicide?
Value: Attempted suicide by cutting his wrists with a piece of broken mirror while in jail
